TEACHER
Professional Summary
Looking for a position to use my strong passion for children's development, together with skills and experience that will enable me to make a significant difference.
Also, to build a long-term career with opportunities for growth and to keep up with the cutting edge of the technologies.

Excellent communication and multi -tasking skills developed from previous experiences Excellent leadership skills, with the ability to take necessary actions in tasks when required Admirable work ethic

<JD_START>
Job Title: Early Childhood Program Manager

Location: Mesa, AZ

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Project Management

Description:
Posting Date

04/18/24

Application Deadline

04/23/24

Pay Range

Full Range: $78,500 - $127,000 annually

Salary offers are based on the candidate's equivalent experience and internal equity with other employees within the same job classification. This position is not eligible for overtime compensation.

Job Type

Unclassified

Department

Human Services

About The Position

The Early Childhood Program Manager is responsible for implementing and managing the program’s high-quality early education component. This position oversees educational staff, ensures assessments and curriculum meet children’s developmental needs, and ensures education services align with division goals to improve the school readiness of enrolled children and build supportive relationships with families.

About Us

In Human Services, we focus on maximizing potential and providing support and resources for all stages of life. We partner with families and communities to encourage children to learn, invite youth and adults to cultivate professional skills, guide families to achieve financial success, and enable seniors to live independently.

Join our team and unlock your potential!

Proud to Offer 

Work with a greater purposeTuition reimbursementExceptional work-life balanceOpportunities for growth and development within Maricopa CountyLow-cost, high-value healthcare for you and your qualifying dependentsPaid vacation, sick time, and parental leaveExtensive wellness program, including healthcare premium discountsEmployee discounts for goods and servicesMaricopa County participates in the Arizona State Retirement System. This defined retirement benefit requires a 12.29% monthly contribution rate and includes a 100% employer match on Day 1Learn more at Work With Us | Maricopa County, AZ

We Require 

Five years of administrative/program experience in early childhood education and two years of management and/or supervisory experienceBachelor's degree or advanced degree in early childhood educationA combination of post-secondary education and/or job-related experience may substitute for the minimum qualifications on a year-for-year basis

We Also Value 

Bilingual skills in English/Spanish 

Job Contributions 

Ensure classroom teaching staff across 83 classrooms in Maricopa County provide responsive care, effective teaching, and an organized learning environment that promotes healthy development and children’s skill growth aligned with the Head Start Early Learning Outcomes Framework: Ages Birth to Five, including for children with disabilitiesLeads daily planning, development, implementation, monitoring, and evaluation of early education services and systems that meet local, state, and federal mandates/regulations related to child development and education servicesManages to provide high-quality early education and child developmental services, including for children with disabilities, that promote children’s cognitive, social, and emotional growth for later school successManages the implementation of curricula based on valid research and standardized training procedure materials aligned to state and federal standards to ensure fidelityEnsures child-level assessment data is entered and utilized to direct continuous improvement related to curriculum choice and implementation, teaching practices, professional development, program design, and other program decisionsLeads the hiring of instructional staff, including developing/updating job descriptions, reviewing applications for employment, conducting interviews, making recommendations for hiring, and completing reference checksFollows the program’s process for using data to identify program strengths and needs and continually evaluate compliance with regulations and progress towards achieving benchmarksDevelops, implements, and monitors programmatic personnel policies and procedures that ensure all children's health, safety, and educational well-beingProvide management and direction to the Program Assurance Supervisors, which will be shared with all classroom instructional staff

Working Conditions 

Background investigation and fingerprint identification performed upon hire to secure the Level 1 Fingerprint Clearance CardMust be able to obtain a valid AZ Driver’s license upon hireWork is routinely performed in an office environment, which may require long sitting, reading, and typing periodsRequires travel to program sites throughout Maricopa County The position requires travel to and from various county, client, and contractor locations during a scheduled workday, subject to County policies regarding the use of County vehicles and/or private vehicles used on County business

Selection Procedure

Only the most qualified candidates will be consideredConsideration will only be given to candidates who submit online applicationsCandidates will be contacted primarily through email and their Workday online application profileMust pass a pre-employment background and/or fingerprint investigation as required by statute or policy, including drug and alcohol testing requirements for positions designated as safety-sensitive

Maricopa County is an equal opportunity employer.

Apply Now!

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
<JD_END>
